sn56.54:1.1: “Mendicants, there are places where the great rivers—the Ganges, Yamuna, Aciravatī, Sarabhū, and Mahī—come together and converge.
sn56.54:1.2: Suppose that water dried up and evaporated except for two or three drops.
sn56.54:1.4: Which is more: the water in the confluence that has dried up and evaporated, or the two or three drops left?”
sn56.54:1.5: “Sir, the water in the confluence that has dried up and evaporated is certainly more. The two or three drops left are tiny.
sn56.54:1.6: Compared to the water in the confluence that has dried up and evaporated, it doesn’t count, there’s no comparison, it’s not worth a fraction.”
sn56.54:1.7: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.54:1.8: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
